name: TuxGuitar Document
summary: Learn about .TG files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: TuxGuitar is a musical score composition program used primarily to chart guitar tabs. It is available for Windows, macOS, and Linux.

After a user creates or transcribes a score and accompanying tablature in TuxGuitar, they can save the document they've created as a TG file. This allows them to continue editing their score and tablature in the future if needed. Users can also export their score and tablature in many common document, score, and audio formats, to view, edit, or listen to the score they've created with other programs.

description: A TG file is a guitar tablature document created by TuxGuitar. It contains both musical score and guitar tablature. Guitar tablature is a form of musical notation that represents finger positions on instrument’s fretboard.

A TG file is a guitar tablature document created by TuxGuitar, a free tab editor. It contains a musical score and accompanying guitar tablature. TG files often contain multiple tracks, used to chart notes and tablature for additional instruments (such as multiple guitars).

instructions:
If you have TuxGuitar file (with .tg extension), you can open it using TuxGuitar software. Here are the steps:

Launch TuxGuitar on your computer.Go to “File” menu.Choose “Open” from menu options.Locate and select your TuxGuitar file (.tg).Click “Open” to open and view your file in TuxGuitar.

This process allows you to access and work with your TuxGuitar files within TuxGuitar application.
You can open a TG file with TuxGuitar (multiplatform). To do so:
Navigate to and open your TG file.
You can use TuxGuitar to convert TG files to the following formats:
To do so, open your TG file in TuxGuitar, and then select File → Export.
